page.title: 19Natural History of Denbigh
page.content: The hill slopes above the{Vale of {Clwyd}support a very fertile local {ecology.}Access roads through the {agricultural land,}between high hedge- -rows, are narrow and tortuous. A walk in late July was delightful with sweet {honeysuckle}and{dog-roses}in plenty. Growth of{bramble, wild clematis, {black thorn, hazel, crab-apple, elder and{hawthorn}was prolific. Later on in{Sept/Oct}there will be fruits to pick in plenty and we will wonder what omens of{Winter}the holly berries fore-cast. In the verges beneath grow a variety of flowers{red campion,speed well etc. {Hawks}and{Owls}are present and flying about are many types of indigenous birds,{Swifts}and{Swallows.Rabbits}hop nervously into hedges,{grey squirrels} can be seen in trees but smaller{ {nocturnal animals}remain unseen.
